page.title: 04Care of Handicapped, Woking
page.content: Crossroads Care Attendant scheme, which began in Woking in January 1981, supports people who care for a physically or mentally disabled person at home. It aims to relieve stress in the family of the disabled person and so avoid admission to hospital. There are several Old People's Homes in the area.Our School,Halstead, gives Harvest gifts to Arreton House, to The Pines where we also sing carols at Christmas and to Beechcroft, a hospital for the elderly. The Westgate Centre, Chobham Road, is a Day Centre for the elderly and the handicapped. We support the Multiple Sclerosis Society which meets there regularly and has an annual Garden Party in our grounds each summer. The Friends of the Elderly run an Old People's Home in Lavender Road and the Bernard Sunley Nursing Home,College Rd
